sentences: Lewis Michael Soloff (February 20, 1944–March 8, 2015) was an American jazz trumpeter, composer, and actor.
From his birth place of New York City, United States, he studied trumpet at the Eastman School of Music and the Juilliard School.
He worked with Blood, Sweat & Tears from 1968 until 1973.
In the 1980s, he was a member of Members Only, a jazz ensemble who recorded for Muse Records.
Soloff was a regular member and sub-leader of Gil Evans' Monday Night Orchestra, started from 1983, and trained his ability as band leader.

His 2010 recording Sketches of Spain is a tribute to the classic 1959-60 Miles Davis-Gil Evans collaboration, and he has performed the reconstructed Evans arrangements of George Gershwin's Porgy and Bess.
